Detailed Description

Abstract representation of communication hardware.

Must be implemented for every transport subsystem like Bluetooth, IrDA, etc. Since internal APOXI objects (like ObexTransport instances) are not able to receive messages the class implements the ObservableObject interface, therefore enabling other objects to attach to AbstractTransport derivatives and be notified via method invokation.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef ObservableObject AbstractTransport::Base
 

Reimplemented in IrdaTransport.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum AbstractTransport::AvState
 

Availability state.

Enumerator:
AvsReady  Can be used without restrictions.
AvsBusy  Temporarily unavailable.
AvsConflict  Not available due to resource conflict.
AvsDisabled  Intentionally disabled.

enum AbstractTransport::NotificationMsgType
 

Enumerator:
NotifyAvStateChanged  AvState has changed !

Member Function Documentation

virtual void AbstractTransport::Enable (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Request enabling of the transport (asynchronously).

This method attempts to enable the transport, posibly involving conflict management intervention or MMI activity. Therefore, every implementation is expected to deliver the result asynchronously by calling OnAvStateChanged().

Implemented in UsbTransport, BtTransport, and IrdaTransport.

Application * AbstractTransport::GetAppPtr (   )  const [inline, protected]
 

Returns the application pointer of the transport application.

virtual AvState AbstractTransport::GetAvState (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the availability state of the transport.

Since state handling can be different for each implementation, this is an abstract method. However, any internal state must be representable by the type AvState

See also:
AvState.

Implemented in UsbTransport, BtTransport, and IrdaTransport.

WString AbstractTransport::GetMmiName (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the friendly name of the transport.

Can be used by MMI applications when the user must be prompted to select a transport media.

void AbstractTransport::OnAvStateChanged (   )  [protected]
 

Indicates change in the availability state of the transport.

This method must be called by every implementation whenever the availability of the transport is changed. This will generate a TransportNotificationMsg which tells subscribers about the state change.

Reimplemented in IrdaTransport.

BOOLEAN AbstractTransport::RegisterTransportApp (  Application *  app_ptr  ) 
 

Registers an application as transport application.

By calling this method and supplying its 'this' pointer as parameter an application becomes the transport application of this transport.

Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, 'FALSE' is case of error (an application is already registered).
